messages.message:
Hi Team. Do we have the gcp client package installed for us to import it in our UDFs?
I have a use case in Colpal for this.

package: https://pypi.org/project/google-cloud-storage/
Sample snippet: https://github.com/googleapis/python-storage/blob/main/samples/snippets/storage_fileio_write_read.py

I get an import error on ib.com (http://ib.com) for this. The purpose is to read and write files from / to a gcp storage bucket.
Our GCP drive mount option is beta. So in case it does not work, we need to fallback to the API approach.

cc: @Biz @Krista Hardebeck @vartika.bhargava @Murali @Piyush @Sreenath Anilkumar

Hi @Venkatesh any reason why you can’t use the current beta support for GCP buckets?

cc @Heymian @Xi Cheng

Hey Shaunak. 2 reasons:

1. Colpal is currently on 22.08 which does not have the GCP bucket mounting option
2. Even if they upgrade the platform, they may oppose going to production with a beta feature
They are yet to comeback on the platform upgrade and using our bucket mounting option, however I just wanted to be ready with plan B in case it doesn't work out
Well you are trying to import this GCP client python library from UDF, so the prerequisite is this package needs to be installed first in celery-app-tasks
Hey @Xi Cheng yeah I wanted to check if we can install it. Would be helpful to test before committing on the feasibility to the client.

@Venkatesh I don't see an issue with installing this package in celery-app-tasks, but that'd require patch deployment and testing too. Additional questions to be addressed, how do you plan to handle authorization v.s. GCP in the UDF? Shouldn't you need creds/private key to do this, and if so where do you plan to store those?

hmm, I would steer away from installing these packages in app-tasks.  They seem like a short term measure that will go away with the 23.04 release.

The other question I will ask is: for the infromation that they want to put into the Google Cloud Bucket, can’t they put the same information in the S3 bucket?
